items.description: Tyne and Wear coast

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. Overtopping is possible between 5pm and 8pm at Hendon, Seaburn Promenades and Roker SeaFront as strong winds combine with high tide. 
Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 9:00 PM on 10/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.55mAOD at 17:15 on 10/09/25.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 10 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next 12 hours.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 18:30 on 10/09/25, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Climping Seafront
items.message: Thursday's early morning tide at 01:00 on 11/09/2025 is forecast to be lower than recent days, and accompanied by strong Westerly Force 6 winds. The weather still increases tide table values by 0.16 metres. The total forecast tide is 6.15 metres Chart Datum (3.1 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Over the next five days, light winds and small waves are forecast, and with tides being lower, only minimal flood impacts are expected. We continue to monitor the forecast. We will reissue this Flood Alert if property flooding could be possible.

items.description: Thorney Island to West Itchenor
items.message: Thursday's early morning tide at 01:00 on 11/09/2025 is forecast to be lower than recent days, and accompanied by strong Westerly Force 6 winds. The weather still increases tide table values by 0.18 metres. The total forecast tide is 5.1 metres Chart Datum (2.36 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. Over the next five days, light winds and small waves are forecast, and with tides being lower, only minimal flood impacts are expected. We continue to monitor the forecast. We will reissue this Flood Alert if property flooding could be possible.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Wednesday evening.    

High water on Wednesday at Plymouth is at 20:32 with flooding possible 1 hour either side of high tide. Times of high water will vary along the coast.  

Locations particularly at risk include exposed coastal areas of Plymouth Sound including Cawsand, Kingsand and The Hoe.  

Waterside locations and roads along the estuary may be flooded.  Do not walk or drive through flood water.    

We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by midday on Thursday, or if the situation changes.    

Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide level at Plymouth on Wednesday evening is 2.81 mAOD.  Expect tide levels to be around 0.17m above tide table level.  Force 5 westerly winds and offshore wave heights of around 1.9m are forecast over the high tide.

items.description: Tidal areas of Littlehampton Rope Walk
items.message: Thursday's early morning tide at 01:00 on 11/09/2025 is forecast to be lower than recent days, and accompanied by strong Westerly Force 6 winds. The weather still increases tide table values by 0.16 metres. The total forecast tide is 6.15 metres Chart Datum (3.1 mAOD) at Littlehampton. Over the next five days, light winds and small waves are forecast, and with tides being lower, only minimal flood impacts are expected. We continue to monitor the forecast. We will reissue this Flood Alert if property flooding could be possible.

items.description: Dorset coast at Poole Harbour

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
High tides overnight may lead to flooding.
No property flooding is expected.
Highest tide level is expected to be at Poole Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Frome and River Piddle at 12:05 AM on 11/09/2025. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time.
Areas most at risk include Poole Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Frome and River Piddle.
Tidal conditions are expected to improve tomorrow and no flooding is expected.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Consider activating any property flood protection products in .
The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Poole Harbour of 1.33 mAODN at 12:05 AM on 11/09/2025, with westerly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.)
We will remove this message by 10:00 AM on 11/09/2025.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Gribbin Head to Rame Head
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening. 

High water at Plymouth on Wednesday evening at 20:32. Flooding is possible an hour either side of high tide. Times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Locations particularly at risk include low lying areas of Fowey including Fore Street, Town Quay, Albert Quay and Caffa Mill Car park, Lostwithiel including Quay Street and the Recreation ground, East Looe and West Looe, Millendreath, Polperro Harbour, and the B3247 at Seaton. 

Do not walk or drive through flood water or waves.  

A flood warning is also in force though no further flooding to properties expected 

We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by midday on Thursday, or if the situation changes.    

Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide level at Plymouth on Wednesday evening is 2.81 mAOD. Expect tide levels to be around 0.17m above tide table level. Force 5 westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 1.9m are forecast over the high tide.

items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening.    

High water at Falmouth on Wednesday at 19:52. Flooding is possible an hour either side of high tide. Times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Low lying coastal communities are particularly at risk including Mevagissey, Portmellon, St Mawes, Swanpool, East Portholland, Par, and Polkerris. 
  

Take care near the coast. Do not walk or drive through flood water or waves.     

A flood warning is also in force though no further flooding to properties is expected. 

We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by midday on Thursday, or if the situation changes.    

Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide level at Falmouth on Tuesday is 2.71 mAOD. Expect tide levels to be around 0.15m above tide table level.  Force 5 Westerly winds and offshore wave heights of around 1.8m are forecast over the high tide.

items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Wednesday evening.  

High water at Falmouth on Wednesday at 19:52. Flooding is possible an hour either side of high tide. Times of high water will vary along the coast.  

 A flood warning is also in force though no further flooding to properties is expected  

Locations at risk may include low lying areas lying areas of Mylor Bridge, A39 at Perranarworthal. 

Detailed Information: Forecast High tide level is 2.71mAOD this is  0.15m above tide table level. Force 5 Westerly winds and offshore wave heights around 1.8m are expected.  

Do not walk or drive through flood water. We will update the situation by Thursday afternoon.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
Higher than normal spring tides are forecast over the coming days. Flooding of roads and low-lying land is possible, property flooding is not expected.
First forecast high-water is 9:00 PM on 10/09/25 with a level of 7.86 mAOD,  a Force 5 westerley direction and second forecast high-water is 9:15 AM on 11/09/25 with a level of 7.38 mAOD and a Force 4 South-westerly wind. Times are local and refer to the high-water time at Avonmouth, mAOD is height above average sea level. Conditions may apply one to two hours either side of the high tide. 
Areas most at risk include the tidal River Avon from Sea Mills to Conham in Bristol and between the Avonmouth Bridge and Shirehampton Park including Pill and Shirehampton.
Further flooding is possible at high-water until Thursday due to higher than normal tides. We are closely monitoring the situation and will be closing flood gates at Pill and Shirehampton.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads where conditions may be hazardous.
This message will be updated by 4:00 PM on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Christchurch Harbour
items.message:
Higher than normal tides overnight may lead to flooding.
Highest tide level is expected to be at Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon at 12:15 AM on 11/09/2025. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time.
Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon.
Tidal conditions are expected to improve tomorrow and no flooding is expected.
We are closely monitoring the situation and checking flood defences.
Consider activating any property flood protection products in Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon.
Please do not drive through floodwater as bow waves may affect adjacent properties.
The detailed tidal forecast for those who use it is for a peak level at Christchurch Harbour of 1.28 mAODN at 12:15 AM on 11/09/2025,  With westerly force 5 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level.)
We will remove this message by 10:00 AM on 11/09/2025.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday evening, Wednesday morning and Wednesday evening. High water at Ilfracombe on Tuesday evening is at 20:00, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 5 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 1.9m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations.  Expect tides to be around 170mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and update on Thursday morning.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Ilfracombe on Tuesday evening is 5.21 mAOD, this is 0.17 metres above astronomical tide level

Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday evening and Wednesday evening. High water at Plymouth on Tuesday evening is at 19:45, times of high water will vary along the coast.
Strong force 4 south westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 2.8m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be around 400mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and update on Thursday morning.
Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Plymouth on Tuesday evening is 2.95 mAOD, this is 0.29 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.description: Mersey Estuary at Warrington
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast for the early hours of Thursday 11/09/2025.
Flooding is possible at low lying lands and roads from 01:15 AM on 11/09/2025 at the following locations:
Fiddlers Ferry, peaking around 01:45 AM
Eastford Road, peaking around 02:00 AM
Arpley Bridge, peaking around 02:15 AM
It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge.
We currently anticipate the Flood Alert level not to be met during the next high tide at around midday 11/09/2025.
Our incident rooms are on standby and we are closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coast at North Morecambe Bay
items.message:
A flood alert has been issued as a result of high spring tides rising this evening and peaking early tomorrow morning and continuing until Friday morning. Tides will rise this evening and be at their peak of 5.7m at approximately 1am on Thursday 11th September. No property flooding is currently forecast.

Please avoid driving through flood water and do not put yourself or others at risk.

We will update this message by 9am on Thursday 11th September 2025, or as the situation changes.

Please avoid driving through flood water and do not put yourself or others at risk.

We will update this message by 9am on Thursday 11th September 2025, or as the situation changes.

We currently anticipate the Flood Alert level to be met during the next high tide during the early hours of tomorrow morning, 11/09/2025.
Flooding is possible around the high tide tonight at 01:00AM on 11/09/2025 with high water levels 2 hours either side.

We are closely monitoring the situation and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message:
Flooding is possible between 7:00 - 9:15pm on Wednesday 10/09/2025. High tides, strong winds and large waves tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. Areas most at risk are coastal roads and footpaths around Spurn Point. We are closely monitoring the situation.

Stay away from beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths, and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. We are entering a period of high astronomic tides, with unsettled weather conditions for the next few days, so this alert may be re-issued if required. 

This message will be updated by 9:00am on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message:
A flood alert has been issued as a result of high spring tides peaking this evening and tomorrow morning. Tides will be at their highest tonight around 22:30 10/09/2025.
 Flooding to properties, roads and farmland is possible at these times, however conditions may apply a few hours either side of the high tide.

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the Severn Estuary from Sandhurst to Chepstow and Sharpness. Locations that may be affected include areas river side of defences where defences are present including Lydney Harbour. Low lying land at Purton on the east bank may also be impacted. High tides may also affect watercourses draining into the Severn Estuary. 

Predicted peaks:- Sharpness 9.9m to 10.2m at 22:30 on 10/09/2025.   

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.
This message will be updated  by 13:00 on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tweed estuary
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
Tidal conditions are expected to improve this morning and no flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Tyne estuary

floodArea.county: Gateshead, Newcastle upon Tyne, North Tyneside, South Tyneside

items.message:
The threat of flooding from this morning's high tide has now passed. Higher than normal water levels are expected along the Tyne Estuary again tomorrow morning, Thursday 11/09/2025, between 5:00 AM and 7:00 AM due to high tides. The peak level at Newcastle Quayside is expected to be between 3.1 and 3.2 mAOD. Property flooding is not expected

We will continue to monitor levels closely and re-issue the flood alert for future tides if required. 

Please be careful along riverside footpaths and low lying land and roads which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

is possible between 5.30pm and 7.30pm at Beadnell Harbour Road and Newbiggin

We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

items.description: Langstone to Emsworth Harbour
items.message: The unsettled weather which brought elevated tide levels along the South Coast has now cleared the area. This afternoon’s tide (on 10/09/2025 at 14:00) at Portsmouth, came in only 2cm over forecast. Tide levels will remain high until Friday afternoon (12/09/2025), before moving towards their neap phase. Therefore, no further Flood Alerts will be necessary during this period.

items.description: South Cornwall Coast from Lands End to Lizard Point
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Wednesday evening.    

High water on Wednesday evening high tide 19:21 with flooding possible between 18:30 and 20:30. Times of high water will vary along the coast.  

Locations particularly at risk include low lying areas around Jack's Bridge, Newlyn, along Penzance promenade and low lying areas around Porthleven harbour 

Waves and spray are likely so take care near the coast. Do not walk or drive through flood water or waves.    

Coastal conditions should ease for Wednesday morning's high tide, however, conditions are forecast to worsen again for Wednesday evenings tide, bringing a further risk of flooding. 

We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by midday on Thursday, or if the situation changes.    

Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide level at Newlyn is 3mAOD. Expect tide levels to be around 0.15m above tide table level. Force 5 Westerly winds and offshore wave heights of around 3m are forecast over the high tide.

Flooding to roads and low lying land adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow is expected at the times of high tides, however conditions may apply a few hours either side of the high tides.
Predicted peaks at Newport 7.7m at 22:00 on 10/09/2025 and 7.2m at 10:15 on 11/09/2025.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.

Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening. High water at Padstow is at 7:59pm, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong force 5 westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 3m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed areas. 

Locations particularly at risk include Little Petherick.

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and update by Thursday afternoon.  

Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Padstow is 4.35 mAOD, this is 0.2 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.description: Wye Estuary at Brockweir
items.message:
A flood warning has been issued as a result of high spring tides peaking this evening and tomorrow morning. Tides will be at their highest between 22:00 today 10/09/2025 and 10:15 tomorrow 11/09/2025. 
Flooding to properties, roads and farmland is possible at these times, however conditions may apply a few hours either side of the high tide. High tides may impact properties and roads in and around Brockweir on the Wye Estuary. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Avonmouth Portbury 7.7m to 8m on 10/09/2025 at 22:00. 
Newport 7.4m to 7.7m on 10/09/2025 at 22:00.

We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 13:00 on 11/09/2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the sea has now reduced, and tide levels, are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding is expected, however, please take care near coastal paths and promenades.

items.description: Coast from Fleetwood to Blackpool
items.message:
We currently anticipate the Flood Alert level to be met with some wave overtopping during the next high tide during the early hours of tomorrow morning, 11/09/2025.
Flooding is possible around the high tide tonight at 00:45 on 11/09/2025 with high water levels 2 hours either side.
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 11/09/2025, or as the situation changes.
